TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national of NORP origin , born in DATE and living in GPE ( the GPE ) . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON Later , a lawyer practising in the GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , the applicant applied for asylum in the GPE or a residence permit for compelling reasons of a humanitarian nature . On DATE , he was questioned by an immigration official for the reasons of his request for asylum . On DATE and DATE , the applicant submitted corrections and additions to the report drawn up by the immigration official . He stated that he feared persecution for political motives .

On DATE , the ORG Secretary of ORG ( ORG ) rejected the applicant 's requests . He was ordered to leave the GPE within DATE . On DATE , the applicant filed an objection ( bezwaar ) with the ORG Secretary against this decision .

On DATE , the applicant was arrested in GPE and detained on remand on suspicion of participation in the commission of assault on a NORP national . On DATE , the public prosecutor informed the applicant that , for lack of evidence , no criminal proceedings would be taken against him .
On DATE , the applicant was heard before ORG for Aliens ' Affairs ( PERSON voor ORG ) in relation to his objection .

On DATE , the ORG Secretary rejected the applicant 's objection . On DATE , the applicant filed an appeal against this decision with ORG ( Arrondissementsrechtbank ) . The ORG Secretary granted the applicant 's appeal suspensive effect as to his expulsion to GPE .
ORG , following a hearing held on DATE , rejected the applicant 's appeal on DATE , including his complaint under LAW . This decision was notified to the applicant on DATE .
In his letters of CARDINAL , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL and DATE , and DATE , the applicant requested the ORG Secretary to reconsider his case and to grant him asylum .

By letter of DATE the ORG Secretary informed the applicant that the proceedings on his asylum request had ended with the decision taken on DATE by ORG and that it was open for him to file a fresh asylum request insofar as he considered that there were new facts and circumstances that had not been examined in the initial asylum proceedings and on the basis of which the outcome could be different .
On DATE , the applicant filed an objection with the ORG Secretary against the letter of DATE , which he considered to be a decision for the purposes of administrative law proceedings .

On DATE the ORG Secretary declared the applicant 's objection of DATE inadmissible , holding that the contents of the letter of DATE were merely of an informative nature and did not constitute a decision for administrative law purposes . The applicant was ordered to leave the GPE immediately .

The applicant filed an appeal with ORG . In the course of the appeal proceedings before ORG , the ORG Secretary withdrew the challenged decision and allowed the applicant to await the outcome of his request for reconsideration in the GPE . Consequently , the applicant withdrew his appeal before ORG .

On DATE , noting that the ORG Secretary had not yet taken a decision on his request for reconsideration of his case , the applicant requested the ORG Secretary to grant him a residence permit as the proceedings had lasted DATE which , according to an established policy , would make him eligible for a residence permit . In this context , the applicant further submitted that also his wife had filed an asylum request in the GPE and that the appeal proceedings before ORG against the ORG Secretary 's negative decision of DATE on her request had been adjourned on CARDINAL DATE on the basis of the decision that was to be taken in the case of the applicant .
